comment: One of the best, most erudite history professors I've ever had! I had him for Maymester and I never thought I'd enjoy 5-hour history lectures as much as I did his. He is very, very knowledgeable about the subject matter and his passion stimulates an interest in even the most apathetic students. He's also extremely helpful outside of class! :)

One of the best professors I have ever had! He is hard and makes you work, but in the end, he is super helpful with emails and grades assignments quickly! You can send him drafts, and he will respond immediately! I had him for Maymester and he was so cool and hilarious! He knows so much and is passionate about what he does!

His catch phrase seems to be, "Having done extensive research on blank, I can tell you..." But given how much he knows, he's not lying. When it comes to the course work, you really have to work for your grade. All his tests are based on lectures, so skipping is a really bad idea. Out of over 100 students, only about 10 got an A on the midterm.

He is extremely challenging and expects a lot from you, but he is INCREDIBLE. He offers feedback and proofreading before turning in assignments. He really wants to see his students put forth effort and succeed. This was a difficult class, but I have learned so much. His lectures are mesmerizing, I highly recommend him! Best professor at KSU!

Staaf is a tough grader, but believe me when I say he cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He gives really good feedback is you allow him to review your assignments before they are due. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF HIS OFFICE HOURS. This class will strengthen your writing abilities.

Don't take this man, he's a sarcastic A hole. He tells you to respect your classmates but then he is not respectful to his students. You have two major test, the midterm and final. You have all of these notes and it is impossible to know what is going to be on the test. He gave me a 50 on the midterm because he did not like my writing style.

If you enjoy writing a ton of papers, this is the teacher for you. They are difficult and he is a very critical grader. I did not appreciate his sarcastic feedback when he graded them. The tests were tough because the were in essay format. When I realized my grades were poor, he did very little to help. I would not recommend him.

There is a midterm and final set up with ID terms and essays. Just know topics and you're good. I studied the day of for both and made a 95 on the midterm and 90 on the final. He let us use notes on the final in the end. There is a cheap novel to read for a big essay. I read 35 pages and made an 85 on it. Just come up with good ideas for it(google)

I had Staaf my first semester of college and he has been one of my favorites by far!! His tests are free response and long but if you study and go to class regularly, you should not have problems doing well. There is a paper about the most boring book ever written but hes really lenient with grading and is so knowledgeable on literally everything!

Super nice guy! No tests or quizzes, only midterm and final which are free response. Have a few assignments here and there but nothing too overboard. No textbook needed. Class is necessary but not mandatory. He knows his stuff, definitely recommend!

Expect to write a lot all his finals you will need a blue book and expect to fill them. He is strait forward you don't have to come to class, but I recommend you do as for it will be the only way you can do good on the test. Also don't forget the homework and you could pull a B in this class no problem. I would recommend taking this class!

Professor Staff really cares about his students. I received an A in his class this past semester which was my first semester at KSU. He was helpful & listened & took the time to understand his students. He did NOT stand for disrespect or rudeness & I respected him for it. He knows his material & definitely made history fun!

Professor Staaf really cares about his students. I ended up with a C in the class and it was due to me not going to class. In his D2L assignments (there are two) and the primary source (you only do one) he grades hard on grammar. His lectures are long, but are definitely informative. Show up to class and take notes and you'll do fine!

Normally I hate history, but Professor Staaf is so passionate about this material it is easy to listen to. However, while the content isn't too hard to understand, he expects you to remember a lot of specifics. He is a very tough grader, and makes you work for your grade. If you did not know much about history before this class you may struggle.

Staaf is a great professor! His lectures are told like stories as he is very animated when he tells them! He is extremely knowledgeable on everything and cracks jokes every now and then to keep everyones attention. The formatting of his tests are hard and there is only the midterm and the final but if you actually study

If you like history, I highly recommend Staaf. He is very knowledgeable in his class. The tests are written, but if you attend class most days then he may boost your grade for effort. If you talk to him after class or in his office, he can be really helpful. You dont need the textbook, but you need another book for an essay in the class.

One of my favorite teachers ever! Great lectures.  Knows his stuff, but creates an atmosphere of participation where all opinions are welcomed.  Very fair.  Just stay on track with reading and assignments and you will do great.  He is also willing to make time for you if you need help.

It makes no sense how smart this man is. He knows everything about everything. Great teacher. Show up to lectures and you will pass. He makes the powerpoints so you can only understand them if you come to class. Though there are no extra credit opportunities, he is extremely willing to help anyone. Not too difficult of a class. I highly recommend!

Be prepared to write. Both his exams are all written (no short answer or multiple choice). His other grades are essays which are pretty easy if you go to the lectures or read his powerpoints. He also is willing to read over any of your assignments if you ask. Beware though, he is a tough grader and cares about grammarstructure.

Professor Staaf is knowledgeable about history and is good at teaching it, but prepare to lose a lot of points on papers for little errors. You better be pro at structure and organization, and he hates block quotes. I failed because of not turning in a draft and the noted errors. Be careful.

Go ahead and accept the fact that you're not gonna get an A in this class. He doesn't give them. You two tests, the midterm and the final. 2 small writing assignments and 2 big ones, one of which is a "critical analysis" of the most boring book ever written. His grading is also more about grammar than the actual content.

Staaf is a great person, and I did ok in the class, but ok doesn't satisfy me. The class wasn't horrible, but I didn't like going. It was boring, and he's extremely opinionated. He gets really off topic sometimes, too. I don't recommend taking him unless you really have to, or all the other teachers left are absolutely horrible.

Professor Staaf is by far one of the most knowledgeable History professors at KSU. He thoroughly goes into every detail of each person, place, and event and is eager to answer questions! He explains in the beginning of the semester how he does not want to see anyone struggle in his class and that he has an open-door policy, and that is 100% true!

Paper grading more about  grammatical nitpicking-substantial point loses over eg. capitalization of uncommon words- than History subject matter. Vague on assignment content expectation & rubric. contradictory on progress feedback-says doing great, but gives mediocre scores. Expect hours lost re-editing due word count limits on papers vs page limit.

One of the best professors at Kennesaw and overall a great person! Even if you have no interest in history, he makes the class great. He is very personable and seems to always be in a happy mood. If he can tell you worked hard for your grade, he is very giving at the end of the semester. A great professor makes all the difference, I loved him!

Professor Staaf is a very knowledgeable professor, he has an incredible memory. It's important to take notes on what he says rather than what is on the Powerpoint. (All Powerpoints are immediately posted and will always be there) He is a fair grader and will let you submit working drafts as many times as you'd like. Seriously the most dedicated guy

He prepares you SO well. Go to class and take good notes, there is only a final, midterm, and a paper and 3 other writing assignments. But he lets you send working drafts and tells you what to fix! I don't see how you could not get an A or B- don't buy the book. He is an amazing teacher, is a GENIUS, and hilarious- makes history so interesting!!!

Professor Staaf was on jeopardy, he know everything ! He doesn't use a textbook and his power points are basically 1-4 words a bullet. You have to listen to him, and write good notes. And Show up of course. The key to passing his class( or any class ) is to know the basics really really well. Easy A, just listen, write notes and reread notes.

Professor Staaf made a class that I was dreading very enjoyable. I'm a science major , so classes based on reading and writing tend to not be my favorite, but Prof. Staaf's lectures feel more like listening to a story and he tells you NOT to buy the textbook. Minimal classwork and homework,  but you must take good notes in order to excel.
Great professor, I really enjoyed his class. The book he made us read was rather dull, but overall his lectures are awesome.
